entry.title: HTTP REST API for bitcoind
entry.summary: In a communication on Tuesday, July 23, 2013, Pieter Wuille stated that the blockchain is not involved in verifying transactions. Instead, it serves as a historical record for other nodes and wallet rescans. However, Andy Parkins argued that the blockchain must be involved to some extent since during a temporary fork, two branches grow, and it's necessary to verify which branch a new transaction belongs to.
